FLIPPER ZERO CAN FD HS SW
Software creating an USB-CAN bridge between host PC and a CAN network
Loading...

Modules | Files | Macros | Enumerations | Variables
CONTROLLER
APP

MVC controller component used to link VIEW (data displayed in flipper screen) to MODEL (application control logic : USB and CAN link operation) More...

Collaboration diagram for CONTROLLER:

Modules

 SCENE-CONFIG
 This is the scene displayed when left key is pressed in SCENE-USB-CAN : it permits to chose Virtual COM port number.
 
 SCENE-EXIT-CONFIRM
 This is the scene displayed when back key is pressed in SCENE-USB-CAN.
 
 SCENE-START
 This is the scene displayed on application entry (when CAN-FD-HS app is selected from flipper main menu).
 
 SCENE-ERROR-DIALOG
 This scene is called when the user tries to enter an application mode (i.e SCENE-USB-CAN) from SCENE-START but USB link is busy.
 
 SCENE-USB-CAN
 This is the main scene used when an application mode is entered. It will mainly run MODEL component and display related informations using VIEW component.
 

Files

file  usbCan_scene.cpp
 scene definitions : This is the logic between different menus of the applications. These scenes permit to bind their corresponding view (cf. VIEW, in particular usb CAN view) to MODEL component.
 
file  usbCan_scene.hpp
 scene definitions : This is the logic between different menus of the applications. These scenes permit to bind their corresponding view (cf. VIEW, in particular usb CAN view) to MODEL component.
 
file  usbCan_scene_usb_can.cpp
 Implements SCENE-START.

#define ADD_SCENE(prefix, name, id)    bool prefix##_scene_##name##_on_event(void* context, SceneManagerEvent event);

Detailed Description

MVC controller component used to link VIEW (data displayed in flipper screen) to MODEL (application control logic : USB and CAN link operation)
